El mejor juego, lo tiene todo y nunca aburre con tanto personaje, modos de juegos e historia.

As a guy who already paid for the Overwatch 1 , and the game became free to play , i got nothing for the price i paid.
logically Overwatch 2 stories should be free for the ones who have already paide for the game once , but it isn't , and im sure that no one would pay second time for this game , i mean i won't 
"Overwatch 2 stories MUST BE free for the ones who already paid for the Overwatch 1"
No geral, fizeram nada para melhorar o jogo e botaram o 2 na frente, o preÃ§o das skins sÃ£o mais caras que muitos jogos bons pela steam.

So I have at least 2500hr in overwatch.  only 80 in OW2, and most of that 80hr was in the closed and open betas.

This is not really overwatch 2.  it is overwatch 1, version two point suck.

it really sucks.  It sucks out loud.  It might as well be called overwatch: Hoover edition, since it sucks so much.

Nothing that was promised during development actually was delivered, and things we already had were taken away.  Balance was shot.  I could play with fewer friends (seriously I was not entirely happy with 6v6 having so few players, 5v5 was even worse).  They wanted to fix the 2-2-2 queue time issues, they could have buffed tanks, and gone for a 1-2-3 team comp, adding an extra DPS, and that would have fixed the problem.  The PvE CAMPAIGN still hasnt shown up, and it seems to never happen.

This is before we get into the monetization model Blizzard inflicted upon a once loyal and robust player base.

This new version of the game made me realize that loot crates are a viable and reliable means of monetizing a game beyond the initial point of sale, financing maintenance and content updates.  I can appreciate battle passes as a strategy, even if I don't like them.  The problem is how this game monetized.  you cannot buy a battle pass, and even playing 100hr of the game, getting all the daily and weekly challenges (which arent guaranteed) earn the next battle pass.  So you will have to shell out $45 a year just to get everything from battle passes, and then they stick playable characters, which are a key part of the game, behind a paywall.

All the skins, sprays, emotes, highlight intros, voice lines, and victory poses I got in the game, (bought a bunch of loot crates, plus the straight cash for special skins like midas roadhog or pirate bastion) over the three years I was playing, now cost over $5,000 if you were to buy all of them in the store, and you cannot get any of them for free any more.

The fact that what blizzard did to this game hurt the game so hard that it is dying should be a warning to stay away.  That damage is so severe that they actually brought it to Steam in order to try to revive it.  The user reviews are warranted.  And I will be removing this from my steam account now.

Go play TF2, the cosmetic system is far better, the loot crates are completely optional, and you can sell the goods you get to other players, or gift duplicates to new players.  The balance is better too.  Or if you really want something new, get yourself a copy of Starship Troopers: Extermination, or wait for Payday 3, or almost literally anything else other than this POS.

Overwatch 2:
It's like Overwatch 1. But a lot more sad. And a lot more micro-transactions. 
Don't let this game trick you into thinking it's "free". P2W Heroes and a (paid?) unfinished PvE? 
0/10 Would not Recommend

Yea I got nothing. The story is one of the only remaining anchors I have for the game and it can be watched for free on Youtube. I still find myself wanting to go back from time to time tho since there's no one to one counterpart to Overwatch. Paladins is close but the Paladins of today feels like a stranger compared to when I played it when it was new. I wanted this similar feeling for Overwatch 2 PvE but oh well.

I now earn 60 gold coins every week playing Overwatch2, with a monthly income of about 240 gold coins, which is the real life income level of 7.2 yuan per month. In 31 weeks, which is 7 months, I can buy an ordinary gold skin of Overwatch2. Although Watchman Pioneer 1 only needs 1000 gold coins to upgrade and return the box, it has a chance to open it, but it has surpassed the level of the vast majority of people in China (including you), This is the proud capital that Overwatch2 has given me. Overwatch has no obligation to give you what you want. It's just a game that brings you joy, but also relies on your small temper? Even if he doesn't let you play, there's nothing wrong with him. Remember, Overwatch doesn't owe you, maybe we all owe Blizzard a thank you. Blizzard spent a lot of effort and money creating Overwatch 2, which was finally released for free to players, but you're not satisfied. Remember, we chose Overwatch, not Overwatch. If you feel bad, you can quit the game. Blizzard and Overwatch don't owe us, but we owe Blizzard Overwatch, thank you, and the production team has been fortunate enough to work hard for over two years instead of verbally demanding compensation from the official. If you think what I said is wrong, you must not understand the value of the 2016 summer.
